@KBalolia To summarise, primates are awesome and there's a lot you can infer about their biology by studying their skeletons!
@KBalolia This is in contrast to gibbons who have a better quality diet, relying more on fruit so don't spend as much of the day chewing
@KBalolia Howlers also have more robust zygomatic arch (bone leading to cheekbone), indicative of amount of their day spent chewing leaves
@KBalolia Howler monkeys have a larger auditory meatus (ear hole), indicative of reliance on acoustic communication at long distances
@KBalolia Notice the difference in encephalisation (brain size) between the two - gibbon is larger which is a characteristic of apes
A few fun facts for my final day at the Field Museum, Chicago. Here are two primate crania (gibbon on left, howlerâ€¦ https://t.co/pmqfmB56cS
